DataElement.preferredName: Blood Collection Tube Preservation Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The method by which the blood was preserved.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood._Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

Concepts.definition: A test tube, capillary tube, or other tube designed for the collection of blood.

Property.preferredDefinition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

Concepts.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.: The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.
The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

PermissibleValues.value: Frozen Whole Blood in Cryovial aliquots
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Frozen Specimen Whole Blood Cryovial Aliquot

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Frozen Specimen Whole Blood Cryovial Aliquot
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.: Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.: A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.
Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.
A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

PermissibleValues.value: Frozen Whole Blood in EDTA tube
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Frozen Specimen Whole Blood Edetic Acid

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Frozen Specimen Whole Blood Edetic Acid
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.: Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.
Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.

The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

PermissibleValues.value: Frozen Buffy Coat / Red Cell Mass aliquots
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Frozen Specimen Buffy Coat Red Cell Mass Aliquot

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Frozen Specimen Buffy Coat Red Cell Mass Aliquot
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.: The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.: The portion of total blood volume occupied by red blood cells.: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.
The middle layer of an anticoagulated blood specimen following separation by centrifugation. It contains most of the white blood cells and platelets.
The portion of total blood volume occupied by red blood cells.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.
